name: brightdata-mcp
description: Enhance AI Agents with Real-Time Web Data via Bright Data's web scraping and unblocking services
long_description: The official Bright Data Model Context Protocol (MCP) server enables LLMs to access, discover and extract web data in real-time. This server allows MCP clients to seamlessly search the web, navigate websites, take action and retrieve data - without getting blocked - perfect for scraping tasks. Features include search engine scraping, web page scraping as markdown/HTML, structured data extraction from popular sites, and browser automation capabilities.

tools.name: search_engine
tools.description: Scrape search results from Google, Bing or Yandex. Returns SERP results in JSON or Markdown (URL, title, description). Ideal for gathering current information, news, and detailed search results.

tools.name: scrape_as_markdown
tools.description: Scrape a single webpage URL with advanced options for content extraction and get back the results in Markdown. This tool can unlock any webpage even if it uses bot detection or CAPTCHA.

tools.name: search_engine_batch
tools.description: Run multiple search queries simultaneously. Returns JSON for Google, Markdown for Bing/Yandex. Processes up to 10 queries in parallel.

tools.name: scrape_batch
tools.description: Scrape multiple webpage URLs with advanced options for content extraction and get back the results in Markdown. This tool can unlock any webpage even if it uses bot detection or CAPTCHA. Processes up to 10 URLs.

tools.name: scrape_as_html
tools.description: Scrape a single webpage URL with advanced options for content extraction and get back the results in HTML. This tool can unlock any webpage even if it uses bot detection or CAPTCHA.

tools.name: extract
tools.description: Scrape a webpage and extract structured data as JSON. First scrapes the page as markdown, then uses AI sampling to convert it to structured JSON format. This tool can unlock any webpage even if it uses bot detection or CAPTCHA.

tools.name: session_stats
tools.description: Tell the user about the tool usage during this session

tools.name: web_data_amazon_product

tools.name: scraping_browser_navigate
tools.description: Navigate a scraping browser session to a new URL

tools.name: scraping_browser_go_back
tools.description: Go back to the previous page in the browser session

tools.name: scraping_browser_go_forward
tools.description: Go forward to the next page in the browser session

tools.name: scraping_browser_snapshot
tools.description: Capture an ARIA snapshot of the current page showing all interactive elements with their refs. This provides accurate element references that can be used with ref-based tools. Use this before interacting with elements to get proper refs instead of guessing selectors.

tools.name: scraping_browser_click_ref
tools.description: Click on an element using its ref from the ARIA snapshot. Use scraping_browser_snapshot first to get the correct ref values. This is more reliable than CSS selectors.

tools.name: scraping_browser_type_ref
tools.description: Type text into an element using its ref from the ARIA snapshot. Use scraping_browser_snapshot first to get the correct ref values. This is more reliable than CSS selectors.

tools.name: scraping_browser_screenshot
tools.description: Take a screenshot of the current page

tools.name: scraping_browser_network_requests
tools.description: Get all network requests made since loading the current page. Shows HTTP method, URL, status code and status text for each request. Useful for debugging API calls, tracking data fetching, and understanding page behavior.

tools.name: scraping_browser_wait_for_ref
tools.description: Wait for an element to be visible using its ref from the ARIA snapshot. Use scraping_browser_snapshot first to get the correct ref values. This is more reliable than CSS selectors.

tools.name: scraping_browser_get_text
tools.description: Get the text content of the current page

tools.name: scraping_browser_get_html
tools.description: Get the HTML content of the current page. Avoid using the full_page option unless it is important to see things like script tags since this can be large.

tools.name: scraping_browser_scroll
tools.description: Scroll to the bottom of the current page

tools.name: scraping_browser_scroll_to_ref
tools.description: Scroll to a specific element using its ref from the ARIA snapshot. Use scraping_browser_snapshot first to get the correct ref values. This is more reliable than CSS selectors.

api_token.title: API Token
api_token.description: Your Bright Data API token from https://brightdata.com/cp/setting/users

web_unlocker_zone.title: Web Unlocker Zone
web_unlocker_zone.description: Custom Web Unlocker zone name (default: mcp_unlocker)

browser_zone.title: Browser Zone
browser_zone.description: Browser API zone name for browser automation (default: mcp_browser)
